law.catch_line: Medical Reports Of Disabled Or Deceased Physicians As Evidence
law.text: In proceedings before the industrial accident board, the medical report of an incapacitated, disabled or deceased physician who attended or examined the employee, including expressions of medical opinion, shall, at the discretion of the member, be admissible as evidence if the member finds that such medical report was made as the result of such physicianâ€™s attendance or examination of the employee.
